column4: can someone explain the purpose that the "root-system" package serves?
Have you read the long description? (available at http://packages.ubuntu.com/lucid/root-system )
yes but i'm not sure exactly what it would be used for
does it optimize file management or something?
no, it's a scientific library for dealing with large datasets for experiments or whatever
i accidently left the room, missed your response if any
no, it's a scientific library for dealing with large datasets for experiments or whatever
It's still not as stable as I'd like. I don't plan on using it for a while.
They get moved off the mirrors to http://old-releases.ubuntu.com
ooh i searched like hell for that answer a while ago lol
so would you have to manually add that URL to software sources?
Preferably, you'd follow the instructions at https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EOLUpgrades and move to something supported.
my ps3 is running ubuntu 9.10 and it doesnt seem to like 10.04, so it's going to EOL ;)
update manager fails and restores to previous state, and CD installer hangs at random points or randomly wont start
with my laptop though, its no problemo :)
